Thursday 16th October

6pm – 9.30pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j_Ga0G2r12k”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754925992954{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

Black in Legal brings together a community of accomplished Black legal professionals to create an unparalleled platform for career advancement and professional excellence. This event connects emerging talent with legal leaders to engage in meaningful conversations about navigating the complexities of the legal profession.

Through a series of candid conversations, attendees will gain access to the hard-won wisdom of those who have broken barriers and reached the pinnacle of success. Whether you’re a trainee planning your career trajectory, an associate seeking advancement, or an established leader looking to maximise your impact, this event provides a space for insight, connection, and inspiration.

Join a distinguished community of Black legal professionals ready to discuss authentic leadership, strategic progression, and a true commitment to driving change across the legal sector.

Key themes:
1. Understand how to launch your legal career with confidence, position yourself for key opportunities, and build powerful mentoring relationships
2. Navigate the path to legal leadership by priming yourself for advancement, building influential networks, and preparing for pivotal career moves
3. Become a driver for change across the legal sector and empower the next generation of Black legal leaders
4. Discover how to nurture strategic relationships that can accelerate your career trajectory and influence
5. Develop the skills, mindset, and strategic approach needed to succeed at the pinnacle of legal achievement [/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”40″][divider line_type=”No Line” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Dr. Tunde Okewale OBE

Barrister, Doughty Street Chambers[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Dr Tunde Okewale OBE is a barrister at Doughty Street Chambers, renowned for his courtroom advocacy, strategic insight, and enduring commitment to justice. He represents senior executives, athletes, creatives, and global organisations in cases involving serious crime, financial crime, civil liberties, and reputational risk.

Raised on a Hackney council estate, his journey from adversity to becoming one of Britain’s most influential legal figures is a story of resilience and purpose. He has overturned wrongful convictions, exposed discriminatory practices, and advised high-profile clients with discretion and precision.

In 2010, he founded Urban Lawyers, a charity that has educated over 50,000 people on legal rights and supported more than 32,000 aspiring lawyers. Honoured with an MBE in 2016 and an OBE in 2024, he now chairs Sport England’s Talent Inclusion Advisory Group, leading national work to widen equity and opportunity in sport.

Nick Harrisingh

Partner, Trowers & Hamlins[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Nick is a partner in the Corporate team at Trowers & Hamlins, experienced in all aspects of corporate work and in particular private company M&A.

Other areas of expertise include joint ventures, group reorganisations and restructurings, corporate structures for inward investment (including Shari’ah compliant real estate structures), AIM IPOs and fundraisings and commercial agreements, many with an international element to them.

Key sectors include real estate investment (particularly build to rent and student accommodation), brewing and hospitality, technology and natural resources. Nick’s clients include companies and institutions, directors, entrepreneurs and owner managers.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” Sharon Blackman OBE

Managing Director, Global Head of Services Legal, Citi[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

An Employed Barrister (England & Wales) and NY Attorney Sharon heads the legal team supporting Citi’s Services business globally and serves on the Legal Management Committee (LMC). She is Chair of the Bank of England FXJSC legal subcommittee and a member of the global steering committee for Citi’s Black Heritage network. A mother of three, she is also a founding member of the In-house Pro Bono Group, trustee and playing member of the Croydon Symphony Orchestra, member of Brunel University Council, Corporate Advisory Board member for Urban Synergy and the Patchwork Foundation and BACFI representative on the Bar Council’s Race Working Group.

In 2021 Sharon was listed in Cranfield’s Women to Watch 2021, became a Bencher of Lincoln’s Inn and was recognized in the Queen’s Birthday Honors with an OBE for services to the financial sector.

Mark Robinson

Barrister, Garden Court Chambers[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Mark has gained a reputation as being a maverick who fiercely defends clients in court and rises to the challenge when dealing with complex legal issues and incorporating novel points of law into his submissions. He is approachable and views it as a priority to convey legal advice to his lay clients in a way they understand.

Mark is regularly instructed for matters in the Crown Court and appears in the Court of Appeal. He is an experienced Gangs Practitioner and accepts instructions for serious youth violence and drug-related offences. He also has experience representing youths and vulnerable adults with a variety of mental health and learning difficulties who require an intermediary.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes”][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Sarah Flambard

Founder of We Are Here & Legal Senior Manager, Macquarie[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Sarah Flambard is an award-winning senior lawyer and finalist at the Black British Business Awards 2025, recognised for leading change across law, finance, and tech. At Macquarie, she advises on complex cross-border derivative deals and plays a strategic role in shaping inclusion at a firm-wide level as co-lead of the firm’s Black Employees Network and a member of its DEI committee.

Beyond her legal career, Sarah is the founder of We Are Here, a tech-for-good platform mapping free services for people experiencing hidden homelessness, and serves as a trustee at Hackney Quest, championing youth empowerment and social mobility.

With roots in France and a voice shaped by faith, justice and lived experience, Sarah is committed to building tools, partnerships, and pathways that expand access and create lasting impact across sectors for her generation and the next.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes”][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Batsho Nthoi

Managing Associate, Addleshaw Goddard LLP[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Batsho Nthoi is a Managing Associate in Addleshaw Goddard’s Asset Based Lending & Trade team, spearheading the firm’s trade and commodities finance strategy. Born and raised in Botswana, he studied law and politics at the University of Botswana before completing an LLM in International Financial Law at King’s College London as a Chevening Scholar.

Batsho began his career as a journalist, winning awards for covering youth, gender, and children’s issues, before qualifying as a lawyer in 2006. He has chaired the Botswana National Youth Council and served as Africa Coordinator for the Commonwealth Youth Caucus.

He has worked in private practice and at Standard Chartered across Botswana, South Africa, and London. He joined Addleshaw Goddard in 2022. He is passionate about mentoring and coaching future leaders.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes”][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Coleen Mensa

Director of Legal & Business Affairs, Orfium[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Coleen Mensa is an award-winning entertainment and technology lawyer who has established herself as a leading authority at the intersection of law, media, and innovation. As Director of Legal & Business Affairs at Orfium, she oversees complex, high-value agreements with some of the world’s biggest entertainment companies, shaping the legal frameworks that underpin the global music and media industries.

Her influence extends far beyond corporate boardrooms. In 2018, she founded the Legal Masterclass series, a pioneering initiative that has provided hundreds of underrepresented aspiring lawyers with mentorship, access, and the tools to thrive in a profession where they are often excluded.

Coleen’s extraordinary contributions to law and diversity have been recognised with numerous accolades. Alongside this, Coleen is a proud mother, balancing leadership, advocacy, and motherhood with authenticity and purpose.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes”][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” Nnamdi Emelifeonwu

Co-Founder & CEO, Definely[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Nnamdi began his career as a solicitor at Magic Circle law firm Freshfields, where he spent four and a half years as a finance lawyer. There, he met his co-founder, Feargus MacDaeid, one of the few registered blind solicitors practising in the City.

Motivated by Feargus’s experience navigating legal documents with a visual impairment, they set out to build a tool to improve accessibility. In the process, they uncovered a broader opportunity to transform how everyone reads and works with legal documents. That vision became Definely, which launched in 2020.

Today, Definely is used by some of the world’s leading law firms, financial institutions, and multinational corporations, including A&O Shearman, Slaughter and May, JP Morgan, IKEA, and Samsung. As one of the few Black founders in the UK to raise over $40 million in venture capital, he actively supports and advises aspiring entrepreneurs from the BAME community.

Natalie Carter

Senior Legal Counsel, Apache Capital[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Natalie is currently Senior Legal Counsel at Apache Capital Partners. Before joining Apache Capital Partners, Natalie worked as a real estate lawyer in the City for over 12 years.

Natalie has a broad range of experience of acquisitions, financing (raising both acquisition and development finance), property management, development, and disposals of various asset classes.

Natalie was noted as a Professional Services Rising Star at the 2020 Black British Business Awards and is the co-founder of Black Girls Book Club, creating a safe space for black women who love literature. Natalie is a founding committee member of Black Women In Real Estate, a Board Trustee for the Creative Land Trust and Hornsey Housing Trust, and works with various charities and organisations to improve diversity.

Landé Belo

Black British Business Awards Finalist & Group Legal Director, Employment Legal, Kantar[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Landé leads the global employment legal function at Kantar, helping drive business strategy and employee engagement by providing sustainable employee and labour relations solutions and tailored legal advice within a global framework.  Landé manages complex multi-jurisdictional projects and supports the business in implementing global diversity and inclusion initiatives.

Parallel to her legal career, she is a passionate theatre director and producer.  Celebrated for its creativity, innovation, and impact on underrepresented communities, her work in theatre has earned industry recognition and accolades.

Kudakwashe P. Anderson-Chinyani

Associate, CMS[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Kuda is an Associate at CMS, specialising in renewable energy projects. Her experience spans project development, project finance, corporate transactions and regulatory advice. She has worked with a wide variety of renewable technologies, with particular experience in onshore wind, battery storage and solar projects.

Kuda has been with CMS since 2022 as part of the Energy Infrastructure and Project Finance team. She is a graduate of the 2050 Climate Group’s Climate Action Leadership Programme. This year, she was nominated and shortlisted for the Professional Services Award at the Young Professional Green Energy Awards, recognising her leadership and contributions to the renewables sector.

Kuda is also heavily involved in CMS’s DEIB initiatives and is at the forefront of discussions on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging within the renewables and legal sectors in Scotland.

Ruth Reid

Barrister, 3TG & Co-Head of the Education Team, Urban Lawyers[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Ruth Reid is a Criminal Barrister at 3TG Chambers in London, where she has established herself as a formidable advocate with a passion for equality, equity and effective representation.

Understanding the complexities and hurdles that aspiring legal professionals face, Ruth took the initiative to create ‘Cake and Counsel,’ a networking platform designed to foster a sense of community and support among those pursuing legal careers.

Alongside her practice and various voluntary role outside the legal sector, Ruth is also the co-head of the Education team for Urban Lawyers, an Equality and Diversity officer for her chambers, on the Bar Council’s Race Working Group and an advocacy trainer for Sikhs in law; intentionally supporting organisations committed to widening access and equality in the legal field.
